availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles C. Young (Hopkins Co., Ky, retired merchant)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, retired merchant. North Carolina native. Married to Evelina Belmont Hall Young in 1823. Father of Nancy E. Young Morton, Caleb H. Young, Julia D. Young, Helen Young, and William F. Young. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Retired merchant in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 121B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 8 of 15 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 831.
National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, NSDAR Lineage Book, Washington, D.C. : NSDAR, 1891-1939, Volume 139: 1918, 100.
Find A Grave, "Charles C. Young (1801-1881)," Memorial #66862737, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/66862737 (accessed October 27, 2020).
